page.title: 05Yaxham Area Shopping Habits
page.content: The children of the Primary School did a short survey on where a sample of the people in Yaxham get their food supplies. Out of 15 families asked, 10 said that they get their meat from East Dereham (about 3 miles away) 2 go to the nearby village of Mattishall and only 1 had their meat delivered. (Deep freeze storage has made a very great difference to villages, enabling stocks of food to be held for a long period. Most people have a car, but the bus service to Dereham is not very good) Nearly everyone has milk delivered daily, but most buy their bread from Dereham shops or the Mattishall Bakery. Local farms and smallholdings provide fresh vegetables and fruit (as does the Post Office Stores in Yaxham and a mobile shop.)
